Package edu.ncsu.csc216.service_wolf.model.incident

Class Incident

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.service_wolf.model.incident.Incident
  • public class Incident
extends java.lang.Object
    Incident represents an Incident object managed by the system. An Incident has fields that contain the necessary details and information for an Incident. Also has Constructors for a brand new Incident as well a Constructor for loading Incidents from a file that may be in different States and contain unique field information. Class has getter and setter methods and toString. Also has subclasses for IncidentState interface, and concrete classes for each state in the finite state machine.
    Author:
    anthonypulsone

    • Constructor Detail

      • Incident

        public Incident​(java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String caller,
                java.lang.String message)
        Constructs a Incident from the provided title, caller, and message. Used for new incident.
        Parameters:
        title - String containing the title of the incident
        caller - String containing the name or id of the caller
        message - String containing the message with more info about the incident
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the parameters are null or empty strings, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      • Incident

        public Incident​(int id,
                java.lang.String state,
                java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String caller,
                int reopenCount,
                java.lang.String owner,
                java.lang.String statusDetails,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> incidentLog)
        Constructs an Incident with data for all fields passed. Utilized by the ServiceGroupReader class to load existing Incidents from text files
        Parameters:
        id - int value that is the incident's id
        state - String representation of the State of the Incident
        title - String containing the title of the Incident
        caller - String containing the name or id of the caller
        reopenCount - int containing the number of times an Incident has been reopened
        owner - String containing the name / id of the owner
        statusDetails - String containing the details about the Incident's status
        incidentLog - ArrayList of Strings containing the messages that have been added to the incident log
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there is any issue with the parameters

      • setState

        public void setState​(java.lang.String state)
        Setter for currentState field. To be used in the constructor for file i/o. Finds the proper State for the String containing the name of the State
        Parameters:
        state - the String representing the state you are attempting to set this to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if parameter is null or empty or not a state

        public static void incrementCounter()
        Increments the counter for Incident id's that have been assigned. Always called by constructor when new Incident is created.

      • update

        public void update​(Command c)
        Calls the updateState method for this Incident's currentState. Can throw the UnsupportedOperationException from the updateState method if thrown due to an attempt to change to an illegal state.
        Parameters:
        c - the command that is to be passed to the updateState method
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the currentState determines that the transition, as encapsulated by the Command, is not appropriate for the FSM
